page.title: 08Dockyard Diving Unit Part 1
page.content: The divers based at the mooring and salvage depot work mainly on buoys and moorings along the River Cleddau and on the firing range in Cardigan Bay.The pickling pond in the dockyard is used as their training area.Salvage work that has been done recently includes two planes and a submarine.The first plane was a Provost R.A.F.trainer which came down in the Welsh mountains.The job was difficult because it came down a thousand feet up in a freshwater lake.The second was an R.A.F.Hunter which ditched in the sea off Portland Harbour.The plane had to be found as,until the crash examiner discovered the exact cause of the crash, all R.A.F.Hunters were grounded.The submarine they worked on was called the Sante Fe which was involved in the Falklands conflict.It was sunk in
